text: After the death of Moses the servant of Yahweh, Yahweh said to Joshua son of Nun, the assistant of Moses, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “My servant Moses is dead. Get up and cross the Jordan, you and all this people, into the land that I am giving to them, to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place that the soles of your feet will tread, I have given it to you, as I promised to Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the wilderness and the Lebanon, up to the great river, the river Euphrates, all of the land of the Hittites, and up to the great sea in the west, will be your territory.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one will stand before you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, so will I be with you; I will not fail you, and I will not forsake you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and courageous, for you will give the people this land as an inheritance that I swore to their ancestors to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be strong and very courageous to observe diligently the whole law that Moses my servant commanded you. Do not turn aside from it, to the right or left, so that you may succeed wherever you go.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scroll of this law will not depart from your mouth; you will meditate on it day and night so that you may observe diligently all that is written in it. For then you will succeed in your ways and prosper.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did I not command you? Be strong and courageous! Do not fear or be dismayed, for Yahweh your God is with you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Pass through the midst of the camp and command the people: ‘Prepare your provisions; in three days you are to cross the Jordan to go possess the land that Yahweh your God is giving you to possess.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: To the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh Joshua said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Remember the word that Moses Yahweh’s servant commanded you, saying, ‘Yahweh your God is giving rest to you, and he is giving you this land.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wives, your little children, and your livestock, they will remain in the land that Moses gave to you beyond the Jordan. All of the best fighting men will cross armed in front of your families; they will help you
speaker: Narrator

text: until Yahweh gives rest to your families as well as to you. They will take possession of the land that Yahweh your God is giving to them. Then you will return to your own land and take possession of it, the land that Moses the servant of Yahweh gave you beyond the Jordan to the east.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered Joshua, saying, “All that you have commanded us we will do, and wherever you will send us we will go.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as we obeyed Moses, so will we obey you. Only may Yahweh your God be with you, as he was with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever rebels against your orders and does not obey your words according to what you commanded us will be put to death. Only be strong and courageous.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two men from Acacia Grove as spies, saying, “Go, view the land, especially Jericho.” So they went, and entered the house of a prostitute whose name was Rahab, and spent the night there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Jericho was told, “Look, some men from the Israelites have come here tonight to search out the land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Jericho sent for Rahab, saying, “Bring out the men who came to you, the ones who have entered your house, for they have come to search out the whole land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the woman took the two men and hid them. And she said, “Yes, the men came to me, but I did not know where they were from.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when it was time to shut the gate for the night, the men left, and I do not know where they went. Chase after them quickly, for you may catch up to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (But she had taken them to the roof and had hidden them in the stalks of flax that she had spread out on the roof.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So the men chased after them on the way to the Jordan at the fords; and they shut the gate behind the pursuers that had gone out after them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before they went to sleep, she came up to them on the roof
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to the men, “I know that Yahweh has given you the land, and that dread of you has fallen on us, and that all the inhabitants of the land melt away in fear because of your presence.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have heard how Yahweh dried up the waters of the Red Sea before you when you went out from Egypt, and what you did to the two kings of the Amorites that were beyond the Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom you utterly destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: We heard this, and our hearts melted, and no courage was left in anyone because of your presence. For Yahweh your God is God in the heavens above and on the earth below.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then please swear to me by Yahweh, because I have shown loyalty to you, and you will also show loyalty to my family. You must give me a sign of good faith,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will spare my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all that belongs to them; you will deliver our lives from death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men said to her, “Our lives for yours. If you do not report this business of ours, we will show you loyalty and faithfulness when Yahweh gives us the land.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she lowered them with a rope through the window, as her house was on the outer side of the wall, and she was residing in the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to them, “Go to the mountain, so that the pursuers will not find you, and hide yourselves there three days until the pursuers return, and afterward you may go on your way.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men said to her, “We will be released from this oath of yours that you made us swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: When we come to the land, you must tie this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down, and you must gather your father and mother, and your brothers, and your whole family to your house.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone goes outside the doors of your house, they will be responsible for their own death, and we will be innocent. Anyone who will be with you in the house, we will be responsible for their death if a hand is laid on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you report this business of ours, we will be released from your oath that you made us swear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said, “According to your word it will be.” Then she sent them away, and they went, and she tied the scarlet cord in the window.
speaker: Narrator

text: They departed and came to the mountain, and they stayed there three days until the pursuers returned. The pursuers searched all along the way but did not find them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two men returned and went down from the mountain, and they crossed over and came to Joshua son of Nun, and they told him everything that happened to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Joshua, “Surely Yahweh has given all the land into our hand; also, all the inhabitants of the land melt away in fear because of our presence.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua rose early in the morning, and they set out from Acacia Grove. And they came up to the Jordan, he and all the Israelites, and they spent the night there before they crossed over.
speaker: Narrator

text: At the end of the three days the officers passed through the midst of the camp,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they commanded the people: “When you see the Levitical priests carrying the ark of the covenant of Yahweh your God you must set out from your place and go after it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there will be a distance between you and it of about two thousand cubits in measurement. Do not come near it, so that you may know the way that you must go, for you have not passed on this way before.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to the people, “Sanctify yourselves, because tomorrow Yahweh will do wonders in your midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to the priests, “Take up the ark of the covenant and cross over ahead of the people.” And they took up the ark of the covenant and went ahead of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, “This day I will begin exalting you in the sight of all Israel, that they may know that I was with Moses, and I will be with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will command the priests carrying the ark of the covenant, saying, ‘At the moment that you come to the edge of the waters of the Jordan, you will stand still in the Jordan.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to the Israelites, “Come here, and hear the words of Yahweh your God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said, “By this you will know that the living God is in your midst, and he will certainly drive out the Canaanites from before you, and the Hittites, Hivites, the Perizzites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Look! The ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the earth is about to cross over ahead of you into the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, take twelve men from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soles of the feet of the priests carrying the ark of Yahweh, Lord of all the earth, rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan will be cut off upstream, and they will stand still in one heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when the people set out from their tents to cross over the Jordan, the priests carrying the ark of the covenant were ahead of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: When those carrying the ark came up to the Jordan, and the priests carrying the ark dipped their feet in the edge of the water (the Jordan was flowing over its banks during all the days of harvest),
speaker: Narrator

text: the waters flowing down from above stood still; they stood up in one heap very far from Adam, the city that is beside Zarethan, while the waters flowing down to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, were completely cut off; and the people crossed over opposite Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the priests carrying the ark of the covenant of Yahweh stood firmly on the dry land in the middle of the Jordan while all Israel crossed on dry ground, until all the nation finished crossing the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: After all the nation finished crossing the Jordan, Yahweh said to Joshua,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take twelve men from the people, one man from each tribe,
speaker: Narrator

text: and command them, saying, ‘Take for yourselves twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan where the priests’ feet stood firmly, and bring them over with you, and set them up in the place where you will camp tonight.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua summoned the twelve men whom he had appointed from the Israelites, one from each tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to them, “Cross over before the ark of Yahweh your God to the middle of the Jordan, and each one of you lift up a stone on your shoulder, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that this may be a reminder among you. When your children ask in the future, saying, ‘What do these stones mean to you?’
speaker: Narrator

text: you will say to them that the waters of the Jordan were cut off from before the ark of the covenant of Yahweh. When it crossed the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off. These stones will be as a memorial for the Israelites for eternity.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Israelites did as Joshua commanded. They took twelve stones from the middle of the Jordan as Yahweh told Joshua, according to the number of the tribes of the Israelites, and they carried them over with them to the camp, and they put them there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, in the place where the feet of the priests carrying the ark of the covenant stood, and they are there to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The priests carrying the ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until everything that Yahweh commanded Joshua to tell the people was finished, according to all that Moses commanded Joshua. And the people hastily crossed over.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when all the people had finished crossing, the ark of Yahweh and the priests crossed over in front of the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh crossed over armed before the Israelites, as Moses told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: About forty thousand armed for fighting crossed over before the presence of Yahweh to the plains of Jericho for battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day Yahweh exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they respected him as they respected Moses all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Command the priests carrying the ark of the testimony to come up from the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua commanded the priests, saying, “Come up from the Jordan.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when the priests carrying the ark came up from the middle of the Jordan, and the soles of the priests’ feet touched dry land, the waters of the Jordan returned to their place and flowed over all its banks as before.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and they camped in Gilgal on the eastern edge of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And those twelve stones that they took from the Jordan, Joshua set up in Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the Israelites, “When your children ask in the future their parents, ‘What is the meaning of these stones?’
speaker: Narrator

text: you will let your children know by saying, ‘Israel crossed this Jordan on dry ground.’
speaker: Narrator

text: For Yahweh your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you, until you had crossed, just as Yahweh your God did to the Red Sea, which he dried up before us until we had crossed over,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all the peoples of the earth may know that the hand of Yahweh is strong, so that you may fear Yahweh your God forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when all the kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan to the west, and all the kings of the Canaanites who were by the sea heard that Yahweh dried up the waters of the Jordan in front of the Israelites until they crossed over, their hearts melted, and there was no courage left in them because of the presence of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Yahweh said to Joshua, “Make for yourself knives of flint, and circumcise the Israelites a second time.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made knives of flint, and he circumcised the Israelites at the hill of the foreskins.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the reason why Joshua circumcised all the people: all the males who went out from Egypt, all the warriors, died in the wilderness as they went out from Egypt on the journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the people who left were circumcised, but all the people born in the wilderness on the journey after they left from Egypt were not circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: For forty years the Israelites traveled in the wilderness until all the nation, the warriors that left Egypt, perished, because they did not listen to the voice of Yahweh. To them Yahweh swore that they would not see the land that he swore to their ancestors to give to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was their children whom he raised in their place that Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised, because they had not been circumcised on the journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when all the nation had finished circumcising, they remained where they were in the camp until they recovered.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away the disgrace of Egypt from you.” Therefore, the name of that place is called Gilgal to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites camped at Gilgal, and they kept the Passover on the fourteenth day of the month, in the evening, on the plains of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day after the Passover, on that very day, they ate from the produce of the land, unleavened cakes and roasted corn.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the manna ceased the day after, when they started eating the produce of the land, and there was no longer manna for the Israelites. They ate from the crop of the land of Canaan in that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when Joshua was by Jericho, he looked up, and he saw a man standing opposite him with his sword drawn in his hand. And Joshua went to him and said, “Are you with us, or with our adversaries?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Neither. I have come now as the commander of Yahweh’s army.” And Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and he bowed down and said to him, “What is my lord commanding his servant?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The commander of Yahweh’s army said to Joshua, “Take off your sandals from your feet, for the place where you are standing is holy.” And Joshua did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jericho was shut up inside and out because of the presence of the Israelites; no one was going out or coming in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Look, I am giving Jericho into your hand, its king and the soldiers of the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will march around the city, all the warriors circling the city once; you will do so for six days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seven priests will bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the ark. On the seventh day you will march around the city seven times, and the priests will blow on the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they blow long on the horn of the ram, when you hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people will shout with a great war cry, and the wall of the city will fall flat, and the people will charge, each one straight ahead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priests carry the trumpets of the rams’ horns before the ark of Yahweh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to the people, “Go forward and march around the city, and let the armed men pass before the ark of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joshua spoke to the people, the seven priests carrying the seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the presence of Yahweh went forward and they blew the trumpets; and the ark of the covenant of Yahweh followed behind them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets, and the rear guard came after the ark, while they were blowing the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua commanded the people, saying, “You will not shout, and you will not let your voice be heard; a word will not go out from your mouth until the day I say to you ‘Shout!’ Then you will shout.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the ark of Yahweh went around the city, circling once, and they came into the camp and spent the night in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua got up early in the morning, and the priests took up the ark of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seven priests carrying the seven trumpets of the rams’ horns before the ark of Yahweh went on continually, and they blew on the trumpets. And the armed men went before them, and the rear guard came after the ark of Yahweh, while the trumpets blew continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they marched around the city once on the second day, and they returned to the camp. They did this for six days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then on the seventh day they rose early at dawn, and they marched around the city in this manner seven times. It was only on that day that they marched around the city seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the seventh time the priests blew on the trumpets, and Joshua said to the people, “Shout! For Yahweh has given you the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city and all that is in it will be devoted to Yahweh; only Rahab the prostitute and all who are with her in the house will live, because she hid the messengers whom we sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, keep away from the things devoted to destruction so that you do not take them and bring about your own destruction, making the camp of Israel an object for destruction, bringing trouble upon it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all of the silver and gold, and the items of bronze and iron, are holy to Yahweh, and they must go to Yahweh’s treasury.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people shouted, and they blew on the trumpets. And when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, they raised a great shout, and the wall fell flat. The people charged, each one straight ahead into the city, and they captured it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they utterly destroyed by the edge of the sword all who were in the city, both men and women, young and old, ox, sheep, and donkey.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said to the two men who spied on the land, “Go to the prostitute’s house and bring out from there the woman and all who belong to her, just as you swore to her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the young men who were spies went and brought Rahab and her father and mother, her brothers, and all who were with her. And they brought all her family out and set them outside the camp of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they burned the city and all that was in it with fire; they put only the silver and gold, and the items of copper and iron, into the treasury of the house of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua spared Rahab the prostitute and her family and all who were with her, and she has lived in the midst of Israel until this day, because she hid the messengers whom Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua swore at that time, saying, “Cursed is anyone before Yahweh who gets up and builds Jericho, this city. At the cost of his firstborn he will lay its foundation, and at the cost of his youngest he will set up its gates.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Yahweh was with Joshua, and his fame was in all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites broke faith concerning the devoted things. Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took from the devoted things; and Yahweh’s anger was kindled against the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is near Beth Aven, east of Bethel, and he said to them, “Go up and spy out Ai.” And the men went up and spied out Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they returned to Joshua and said to him, “Do not let all the people go up and attack Ai; only two or three thousand men should go up because they are few. Do not make all the people weary up there.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So about three thousand from the people went up there, and they fled before the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, and they chased them from the gate up to Shebarim and killed them on the slope. And the hearts of the people melted and became like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua tore his clothes and fell to the ground on his face before the ark of Yahweh until the evening, he and the elders of Israel; and they put dust on their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, “Ah, my Lord! Why did you bring this people across the Jordan to give us into the hand of the Amorites to destroy us? If only we had been content and stayed beyond the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Please, my Lord! What can I say after Israel has fled from its enemies?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of this, and they will surround us and cut off our name from the land. What will you do, for your great name?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Stand up! Why have you fallen on your face?
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel has sinned and transgressed my covenant that I commanded them. They have taken from the devoted things; they have stolen and acted deceitfully, and they have put them among their belongings.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites were unable to stand before their enemies; they fled from their enemies because they have become a thing devoted for destruction. I will be with you no more unless you destroy the devoted things from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get up, sanctify the people, and say, ‘Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow. Thus says Yahweh the God of Israel: “There are devoted things in your midst, O Israel. You will be unable to stand before you enemies until you remove the devoted things from your midst.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning you will come forward, tribe by tribe, and the tribe that Yahweh will select by lot will come forward by clans, and the clan that Yahweh selects by lot will come forward by families, and the family that Yahweh selects by lot will come forward one by one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one caught with the devoted things will be burned with fire, he and all that belongs to him, because he transgressed the covenant of Yahweh, and because he did a disgraceful thing in Israel.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua rose early in the morning and brought forward Israel, tribe by tribe, and the tribe of Judah was selected by lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought forward the clans of Judah and selected the clan of the Zerahites by lot. Then he brought forward the clan of the Zerahites, one by one, and Zabdi was selected by lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought forward his family, one by one, and Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was selected by lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to Achan, “My son, please, give glory to Yahweh the God of Israel, and give him a doxology in court. Tell me, please, what you have done; do not hide it from me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Achan answered Joshua and said, “It is true. I have sinned against Yahweh the God of Israel, and this is what I did:
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw among the spoil a beautiful robe from Shinar, two hundred shekels of silver, and one bar of gold that weighed fifty shekels; I coveted them and took them. They are hidden in the ground inside my tent, and the silver is under it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua sent messengers, and they ran to the tent; and there they were, hidden in his tent, and the silver was under it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took them from the tent and brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites. And they spread them out before the presence of Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan son of Zerah, the silver, the robe, the bar of gold, his sons and daughters, his cattle and donkeys, his sheep, his tent, and everything that was his, and they brought them to the valley of Achor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, “Why did you bring us trouble? Yahweh will bring you trouble on this day.” And all Israel stoned them with stones; and they burned them with fire after they stoned them with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they placed on top of him a great pile of stones that remains to this day. And Yahweh turned from his burning anger, and thus the name of that place to this day is called the valley of Achor.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Yahweh said to Joshua, “Do not fear or be dismayed. Take all the fighting men with you and go up immediately to Ai. Look, I am giving into your hand the king of Ai, his city, and his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will do to Ai and its king that which you did to Jericho and its king; you may take only its spoils and livestock as booty for yourself. Set for yourself an ambush against the city from behind it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua and all the fighting men went up immediately to Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand of the best fighting men and sent them by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them, saying, “Look, you are to lay an ambush against the city from behind. Do not go very far from the city and be ready.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I and all of the people who are with me will approach the city. And when they go out to meet us as before, we will flee from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will come out after us until we draw them away from the city, because they will think, ‘They are fleeing from us as before.’ So we will flee from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you will rise up from the ambush and take possession of the city, for Yahweh your God will give it into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when you capture the city you will set it on fire as Yahweh commanded. Look, I have commanded you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua sent them out, and they went to the place of the ambush, and they sat between Bethel and Ai, to the west of Ai; but Joshua spent the night with the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua rose early in the morning and mustered the people, and he went up with the elders of Israel before the people of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the fighting men who were with him went up and drew near before the city and camped north of Ai; there was a valley between him and Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took about five thousand men and set them in ambush between Bethel and Ai, to the west of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they stationed the forces; all the army was north of the city while the rear guard was west. But Joshua went that night to the middle of the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the king of Ai saw this, the men of the city hurried and rose early and went out to meet Israel for battle—he and all his army—to the meeting place before the Arabah. He did not know that there was an ambush for him behind the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua and all Israel acted like they were beaten before them, and they fled in the direction of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: All of the people who were in the city were called to pursue after them. As they pursued after Joshua, they were drawn away from the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not a man remained in Ai or Bethel who had not gone out after Israel; they left the city open and pursued after Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Stretch out the sword that is in your hand to Ai, because I will give it into your hand.” And Joshua stretched out the sword that was in his hand to the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: The moment he stretched out his hand, those in the ambush stood up quickly from their place and ran. And they went into the city and captured it, quickly setting the city ablaze with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Ai looked behind them, and they saw smoke from the city rising to the sky; they had no power to flee this way or that, and the people fleeing the wilderness turned around to the pursuers.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city and that the smoke of the city was rising; they returned and struck down the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the others from the city came out to meet them, and they found themselves surrounded by Israel, some on one side, and others on the other side. And they struck them down until no survivor or fugitive was left.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they captured the king of Ai alive, and they brought him to Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Israel finished slaughtering all the inhabitants of Ai in the open field, in the wilderness where they pursued them, and when all of them had fallen by the edge of the sword until they all had perished, all Israel returned to Ai and attacked it with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people that fell on that day, both men and women, were twelve thousand—all the inhabitants of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Joshua did not draw back his hand that was stretched out with the sword until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the livestock and the spoil of that city Israel took as booty for themselves, according to the word of Yahweh that Joshua commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua burned Ai and made it an everlasting heap of rubbish, a desolate place until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Ai he hanged on a tree until the time of evening, and as the sun went down Joshua commanded them, and they brought down his dead body from the tree. Then they threw it at the entrance of the gate of the city, and they raised over it a great heap of stones that remains to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua built an altar on Mount Ebal for Yahweh the God of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: as Moses Yahweh’s servant commanded the Israelites, as it is written in the scroll of the law of Moses: “an altar of unhewn stones on which no one has wielded an iron implement.” And they offered burnt offerings on it and sacrificed fellowship offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there Joshua wrote on the stones a copy of the law of Moses, which he had written, in the presence of the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all Israel, foreigner as well as native, with the elders, officials, and judges stood on either side of the ark before the priests and the Levites, who carried the ark of the covenant of Yahweh. Half of them stood in front of Mount Gerizim, and the other half in front of Mount Ebal, as Moses Yahweh’s servant had commanded before to bless the people of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And afterward he read all the words of the law, the blessings and the curses, according to all that was written in the scroll of the law.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a word from all that Moses commanded that Joshua did not read before the assembly of all Israel, and the women, the little children, and the traveling foreigners among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the kings who were beyond the Jordan in the hill country and in the Shephelah, and on all the coast of the great sea toward Lebanon—the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites—heard of this,
speaker: Narrator

text: they gathered themselves together to fight with one accord against Joshua and Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua did to Jericho and Ai,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they acted on their part with cunning: they went and prepared provisions, and took worn-out sacks for their donkeys and old wineskins that were torn and mended.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sandals on their feet were patched and old, their clothes were old, and their food was dry and crumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they went to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal and said to him and to the men of Israel, “We have come from a far land; so then make a covenant with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Israel said to the Hivites, “Perhaps you are living among us; how can we make a covenant with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Joshua, “We are your servants.” And Joshua said to them, “Who are you, and from where do you come?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, “Your servants have come from a very far land because of the name of Yahweh your God; we have heard of his reputation, of all that he did in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: and of all that he did to the two kings of the Amorites who were beyond the Jordan—to Sihon king of Heshbon and to Og king of Bashan, who was in Ashtaroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: So our elders said to us and all the inhabitants of our land, ‘Take in your hand provisions for the journey, and go to meet them, and say to them, “We are your servants; so then make a covenant with us.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is our bread; it was hot when we took it from our houses as provisions on the day we set out to come to you. But now, look, it is dry and crumbled.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the wineskins that we filled new, but look, they have burst; and these are our clothes and sandals that have worn out from the very long journey.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the leaders took from their provisions, but they did not ask direction from Yahweh.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua made peace with them, and he made a covenant with them to allow them to live happily, and the leaders of the congregation swore an oath to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that at the end of three days, after they made a covenant with them, they heard that they were their neighbors and living among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Israelites set out and went to their cities on the third day (their cities were Gibeon, Kephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath Jearim).
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites did not attack them, because the leaders of the congregation had sworn to them by Yahweh the God of Israel. And all the congregation murmured against their leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all the leaders of the congregation said, “We have sworn to them by Yahweh the God of Israel, and so we cannot touch them.
speaker: Narrator

text: This we will do to them: we will let them live so that wrath will not be on us because of the oath we swore to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the leaders said to them, “Let them live.” So they became woodcutters and water carriers for all the congregation, just as the leaders had said to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua summoned them and said, “Why have you deceived us saying, ‘We are very far from you’ when you are living among us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore you are cursed; some of you will always be slaves as woodcutters and water carriers for the house of my God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered Joshua and said, “Because it was told with certainty to your servants that Yahweh your God commanded Moses his servant to give to you all the land and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land before you, so we were very afraid for our lives because of you, and so we did this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, look, we are in your hand; do with us whatever seems good and right in your eyes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So he did this to them: he saved them from the hand of the Israelites, and they did not kill them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that day Joshua made them woodcutters and water carriers for the congregation and for the altar of Yahweh, to this day, in the place that he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened that when Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem heard that Joshua captured Ai and had utterly destroyed it (just as he had done to Jericho and its king, so he did to Ai and its king) and that the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel and were among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: he became very afraid because Gibeon was a very large city, like one of the royal cities, and because it was larger than Ai, and all its men were mighty warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Adoni-Zedek king of Jerusalem sent word to Hohman king of Hebron, to Piram king of Jarmuth, to Japhia king of Lachish, and to Debir king of Eglon, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come up and help me, and let us attack Gibeon, because it has made peace with Joshua and the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, gathered together and went up, they and all their forces, and they laid siege to Gibeon and made war against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Gibeon sent word to Joshua at the camp at Gilgal, saying, “Do not abandon your servant. Come up to us quickly and save us! Help us, for all the kings of the Amorites who dwell in the hill country have gathered against us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua went up from Gilgal, he and all the fighting men with him, all the best warriors.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I have given them into your hand; no one will withstand you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua came upon them suddenly by marching up all night from Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh threw them into panic before Israel, who struck them with a great blow at Gibeon and pursued them by the way of the ascent of Beth-horon and struck them as far as Azekah and Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they were fleeing from Israel, they were on the slope of Beth-horon, and Yahweh threw huge stones from the heavens on them as far as Azekah; and more died by the hail stones than those whom the Israelites killed by the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Joshua spoke to Yahweh, on the day Yahweh gave the Amorites over to the Israelites, and he said in the sight of Israel,
“Sun in Gibeon, stand still,
    and moon, in the valley of Aijalon.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped,
    until the nation took vengeance on its enemies.
Is it not written in the scroll of Jashar? The sun stood still in the middle of the heaven and was not in haste to set for about a full day.
speaker: Narrator

text: There has not been a day like this before it or after, that Yahweh listened to the voice of a man; for Yahweh fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua returned and all Israel with him to the camp at Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these five kings fled and hid themselves in the cave at Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told to Joshua, saying, “The five kings were found hidden in the cave at Makkedah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, “Roll large stones against the mouth of the cave, and set men in front of it to guard them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But do not stay there; pursue after your enemies and attack them from the rear. Do not allow them to go into their cities, for Yahweh your God has given them into your hand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua and the Israelites had finished striking them with a very great blow, until they perished, those of them who survived went into the fortified cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the people returned to the camp safely to Joshua at Makkedah. No one spoke against the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring to me those five kings from the cave.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did so, and brought him these five kings from the cave, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they brought these kings to Joshua, Joshua called all the men of Israel and said to the commanders of the fighting men who had gone with him, “Come near, put your feet on the necks of these kings.” So they came near and put their feet on their necks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to them, “Do not be afraid or dismayed! Be strong and bold, for thus Yahweh will do to all your enemies whom you are about to fight.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after this Joshua struck them down and killed them, and he hanged them on five trees. And they were hanging on the trees until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened at the time of sunset, Joshua commanded, and they took them down from the trees and threw them into the cave where they had hidden themselves, and they put large stones against the mouth of the cave, which are there to this very day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua captured Makkedah on that day, and he struck it and its king with the edge of the sword; he utterly destroyed it and everyone that was in it. He did not leave behind a survivor. So he did to the king of Makkedah just as he did to the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua passed on, and all of Israel with him, from Makkedah to Libnah, and he fought against Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh also gave it into the hand of Israel, and its king and all the people in it he struck with the edge of the sword. He left in it no survivor. He did to its king just as he did to the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua passed on, and all of Israel with him, from Libnah to Lachish, and he laid siege to it and fought against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh gave Lachish into the hand of Israel, and he captured it on the second day. He struck it with the edge of the sword, and everyone in it, just as he did to Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish, and Joshua struck him and his people until he left no survivor behind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua passed on, and all of Israel with him, from Lachish to Eglon, and they laid siege to it and fought against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they captured it on that day, and he struck it with the edge of the sword, and all the people that were in it on that day he utterly destroyed as he had done to Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua went up, and all Israel with him, from Eglon to Hebron, and they fought against it
speaker: Narrator

text: and captured it, and they struck it with the edge of the sword, its king and all its cities, and all the people that were in it; he left behind no survivor, as he had done to Eglon, and he utterly destroyed it and all the people that were in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua returned to Debir, and all of Israel with him, and they fought against it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he captured it and its king and all its cities, and they struck them with the the edge of the sword, and they utterly destroyed all the people that were in it; he left behind no survivor, just as he had done to Hebron. Thus he did to Debir and its king what he had done to Libnah and its king.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua struck all the land—the hill country, the Negev, the Shephelah, and the slopes—and all their kings; he left behind no survivor, and all that breathed he utterly destroyed as Yahweh the God of Israel commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua struck them from Kadesh Barnea to Gaza, and all the land of Goshen up to Gibeon;
speaker: Narrator

text: all of these kings and their land Joshua captured at one time, because Yahweh the God of Israel fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua returned, and all Israel with him, to the camp at Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when Jabin king of Hazor heard this, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Acshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to the kings who were in the north in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Kinnereth, in the Shephelah, and in Naphoth Dor in the west,
speaker: Narrator

text: to the Canaanites in the east and west, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, and the Jebusites in the hill country, and the Hivites at the foot of Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came out, they and all their armies with them, as a great army like the sand on the seashore, with very many horses and chariots.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all these kings joined forces, and they came and camped together by the waters of Merom to fight with Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid because of their presence, for tomorrow at this time I will hand them over slain to Israel; you will hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua, and all the fighting men with him, came against them suddenly at the waters of Merom, and they attacked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Yahweh gave them into the hand of Israel, and they struck them and pursued them up to Great Sidon and Misrephoth Maim, and eastward up to the valley of Mizpeh. And they struck them until they left behind no survivor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua did to them as Yahweh commanded him; he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua turned back at that time, and he captured Hazor and struck its king with the sword, because Hazor formerly was the head of all these kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: He struck all the people that were in it with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them. There was no one left who breathed, and he burned Hazor with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua captured all the cities of these kings, and all their kings, and he utterly destroyed them with the edge of the sword, as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel did not burn the cities standing on their mounds, except Hazor alone, which Joshua burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the spoil and livestock of these cities the Israelites took as booty; they struck the people with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them—they left behind no one who breathed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as Yahweh commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and Joshua did; he left nothing undone that Yahweh had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua took all this land: the hill country, all the Negev, all the land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, and the hill country of Israel and its Shephelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: from Mount Halak that rises to Seir and to Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon at the foot of Mount Hermon; he captured all their kings, struck them, and killed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many days Joshua made war with all these kings.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a city that made peace with the Israelites besides the Hivites and the inhabitants of Gibeon—all were taken in battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it was Yahweh that hardened their hearts, to meet Israel in war in order to utterly destroy them without mercy, that they would destroy them just as Yahweh commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Joshua came and exterminated the Anakites from the hill country, from Hebron, Debir, Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel; Joshua utterly destroyed them with their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: None of the Anakites were left in the land of the Israelites; some remained only in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua took all the land according to all that Yahweh had spoken to Moses; and Joshua gave it as an inheritance to Israel, according to their tribal divisions, and the land rested from war.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the kings of the land whom the Israelites defeated, and of whose land they took possession beyond the Jordon to the east, from the wadi of Arnon up to Mount Hermon, and all the Arabah to the east:
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and ruled from Aroer, which is on the edge of the wadi of Arnon, from the middle of the valley and half of Gilead, up to the Jabbok River, which marks the border of the Ammonites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Arabah up to the Kinnereth Sea to the east, and as far as the sea of Arabah, the Salt Sea to the east, in the direction of Beth Jeshimoth, and to the area southward, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah;
speaker: Narrator

text: the territory of Og king of Bashan, one of the last of the Rephaites, who lived at Ashtaroth and Edrei
speaker: Narrator

text: and ruled over Mount Hermon and Salecah and over all Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and half of Gilead, as far as the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses Yahweh’s servant and the Israelites defeated them; and Moses Yahweh’s servant gave it as a possession to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the kings of the land whom Joshua and the Israelites defeated beyond to the Jordan to the west, from Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon, and up to Mount Halak, which rises to Seir. And Joshua gave it as a possession to the tribes of Israel according to their allotments,
speaker: Narrator

text: in the hill country, the Shephelah, the Arabah, on the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negev; the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites:
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jericho, one; the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jerusalem, one; the king of Hebron, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Jarmuth, one; the king of Lachish, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Eglon, one; the king of Gezer, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Debir, one; the king of Geder, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Hormah, one; the king of Arad, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Libnah, one; the king of Adullam, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Makkedah, one; the king of Bethel, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Tappuah, one; the king of Hepher, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Aphek, one; the king of Lasharon, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Madon, one; the king of Hazor, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Shimron-meron, one; the king of Acshaph, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Taanach, one; the king of Megiddo, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Kedesh, one; the king of Jokneam in Carmel, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Dor in Naphath Dor, one; the king of Goiim for Gilgal, one;
speaker: Narrator

text: the king of Tirzah, one; all the kings, thirty-one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and Yahweh said to him, “You are old and advanced in years, and very much of the land remains to be possessed.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the remaining land: all the regions of the Philistines, and all of the Geshurites,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the Shihor, which is east of Egypt, up to the border of Ekron to the north, which is reckoned as Canaanite; there are five Philistine rulers: the Gazites, Ashdodites, Ashkelonites, Gittites, Ekronites, and the Avvim.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the south; all the land of the Canaanites, and Mearah, which belongs to the Sidonians up to Aphek, to the border of the Amorites,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the land of the Gebalites, and all the Lebanon, toward the east, from Baal Gad at the foot of Mount Hermon up to Lebo-Hamath;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the inhabitants of the hill country, from the Lebanon up to Misrephoth Maim, and all the Sidonians. I will drive them out from before the Israelites; only allocate it to Israel as an inheritance just as I have commanded you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, divide this land as an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: With it the Reubenites, and the Gadites received their inheritance, which Moses gave them beyond the Jordan to the east, just as Moses Yahweh’s servant gave to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: from Aroer, which is on the edge of the wadi of Arnon, and the city which is in the middle of the wadi, and all the plateau from Medeba up to Dibon;
speaker: Narrator

text: and all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon up to the border of the Ammonites;
speaker: Narrator

text: and Gilead, and the border of the Geshurite and the Maacathites, all of Mount Hermon, and Bashan up to Salecah;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the kingdom of Og in Bashan, who reigned in Ashtaroth and Edrei—he was left over from the survivors of the Rephaim; these Moses had defeated and driven out.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Israelites did not drive out the Geshurites or the Maacathites; Geshur and Maacah live among Israel to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the tribe of Levites Moses did not give an inheritance; the offerings made by fire to Yahweh the God of Israel are their inheritance, just as he promised to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of the descendants of Reuben according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory was from Aroer, which was on the edge of the wadi of Arnon, and the city that is in the middle of the valley, and all the plateau by Medeba;
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon and its cities that are on the plateau; Dibon, Bamoth Baal, Beth Baal Meon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth Shahar on the hill of the valley;
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth;
speaker: Narrator

text: all of the cities of the plateau, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, who reigned in Heshbon and whom Moses defeated with the leaders of Midian, Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, the princes of Sihon who dwelled in the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: In addition to their slain, the Israelites killed with the sword Balaam son of Beor, who practiced divination.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border of the descendants of Reuben was the Jordan and its banks. This was the inheritance of the descendants of Reuben according to their families, the cities, and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance to the tribe of Gad, to the descendants of Gad, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory was Jazer and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the Ammonites up to Aroer, which is east of Rabbah;
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Heshbon up to Ramah-Mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim up to the territory to Debir;
speaker: Narrator

text: in the valley of Beth Haram, Beth Nimrah, Succoth, Zaphon, and the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon, the Jordan and its banks, up to the lower end of the Kinnereth Sea beyond the Jordan to the east.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the Gadites according to their families, the cities, and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses gave an inheritance to the half-tribe of Manasseh; it was for the half-tribe of the descendants of Manasseh according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their territory was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the settlements of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: and half of Gilead, with Ashtaroth, Edrei, and the cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan; these were allotted to the children of Makir son of Manasseh, for half of the children of Makir according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the territories that Moses gave as an inheritance on the desert-plateau of Moab, beyond the Jordan, east of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the tribe of Levi Moses did not give an inheritance; Yahweh the God of Israel, he is their inheritance, just as he promised them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the territories that the Israelites inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the families of the tribes of the Israelites gave as an inheritance to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their inheritance was by lot, just as Yahweh commanded through the hand of Moses, for the nine tribes and the half-tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses had given an inheritance of the two tribes and the half-tribe beyond the Jordan, but to the Levites he gave no inheritance among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the descendants of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, and they did not give a plot of ground to the Levites in the land, only cities to live in, with their pastureland for their flocks and for their goods.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as Yahweh commanded Moses, so the Israelites did; and they allotted the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the descendants of Judah came to Joshua at Gilgal; and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him, “You know the word that Yahweh said to Moses the man of God at Kadesh Barnea concerning you and me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I was forty years old when Moses Yahweh’s servant sent me from Kadesh Barnea to spy out the land, and I returned with an honest report.
speaker: Narrator

text: My companions who went up with me made the hearts of the people melt, but I remained true to Yahweh my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses swore on that day, saying, ‘Surely the land that your foot has trodden on will be an inheritance to you and your sons forever, because you remained true to Yahweh my God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So then, look, Yahweh has kept me alive just as he promised these forty-five years, from the time that Yahweh spoke this word to Moses while Israel wandered in the wilderness. Now look, today I am eighty-five years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: Today I am still strong, just as on the day that Moses sent me; as my strength was then, so now also is my strength for war and for daily activities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now give me this hill country that Yahweh spoke of on that day, for you heard on that day that the Anakites were there, with great and fortified cities. Perhaps Yahweh is with me, and I will drive them out just as Yahweh promised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua blessed him and gave Hebron to Caleb son of Jephunneh as an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus Hebron became the inheritance of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite to this day, because he remained true to Yahweh the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of Hebron formerly was Kiriath Arba; Arba was the greatest person among the Anakites. And the land rested from war.
speaker: Narrator

text: The allotment for the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their families reached to the border of Edom, to the wilderness of Zin, to the far south.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their southern border was from the end of the Salt Sea, from the bay facing southward;
speaker: Narrator

text: it continues to the south to the ascent of Akrabbim, passes along to Zin, it goes up south of Kadesh Barnea, passes along Hezron, goes up to Addar, and makes a turn to Karka;
speaker: Narrator

text: it passes on to Azmon, continues by the wadi of Egypt, and it ends at the sea. This will be your southern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: The eastern border is the Salt Sea up to the mouth of the Jordan. The border on the northern side runs from the bay of the sea at the mouth of the Jordan;
speaker: Narrator

text: the border goes up to Beth-hoglah and passes along north of Beth Arabah; and the border goes up the stone of Bohan son of Reuben;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the border goes up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and to the north, turning to Gilgal, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, which is south of the wadi; and the border passes on to the waters of En Shemesh, and it ends at En Rogel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border goes up by the Valley of Ben Hinnom to the slope of the Jebusites from the south (that is, Jerusalem); and the border goes up to the top of the mountain that lies opposite the valley of Hinnom to the west, which is at the end of the valley of Rephaim to the north;
speaker: Narrator

text: then the border turns from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, and continues from there to the cities of Mount Ephron; the border then turns to Baalah (that is, Kiriath Jearim);
speaker: Narrator

text: and the border goes around from Baalah to the west, to Mount Seir, and passes on to the slope of Mount Jearim from the north (that is, Kesalon), and goes down to Beth Shemesh, and passes along by Timnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border continues to the slope of Ekron to the north, then bends around to Shikkeron, it passes on to Mount Baalah and continues to Jabneel; and the border ends at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the western border is to the Great Sea and its coast. This is the border surrounding the descendants of Judah according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the commandment of Yahweh to Joshua, he gave to Caleb son of Jephunneh a plot of ground among the descendants of Judah, Kiriath Arba, which is Hebron (Arba was Anak’s father).
speaker: Narrator

text: Caleb drove out from there three of Anak’s sons, Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from there he went up against the inhabitants of Debir (the former name of Debir was Kiriath Sepher).
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb said, “Whoever attacks Kiriath Sepher and captures it, I will give to him my daughter Acsah as a wife.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Othniel son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb, captured it, and he gave to him Acsah his daughter as a wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: When she came to him she urged him to ask her father for a field. So she dismounted from the donkey, and Caleb said to her, “What do you want?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said to him, “Give to me a gift; you have given me the land of the Negev, and you must give to me a spring of water.” And he gave to her the upper and lower spring.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the descendants of Judah according to their families:
speaker: Narrator

text: the cities belonging to the tribe of the descendants of Judah to the far south, to the border of Edom to the south, were Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazor Hadattah, Kerioth Hezron (that is, Hazor),
speaker: Narrator

text: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar Gaddah, Heshmon, Beth Pelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar Shual, Beersheba, Biziothiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltolad, Kesil, Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain, and Rimmon; in all, twenty-nine cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the Shephelah: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zanoah, En Gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim; fourteen cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal Gad,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dilean, Mizpah, Joktheel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Cabbon, Lahma, Kitlish,
speaker: Narrator

text: Gederoth, Beth Dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah; sixteen cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jephthah, Ashnah, Nezib,
speaker: Narrator

text: Keilah, Aczib, and Mareshah; nine cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ekron, its towns and villages;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Ekron to the sea, and all that were near Ashdod and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashdod, its towns and villages; Gaza, its towns and villages, up to the wadi of Egypt and the Great Sea and its coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dannah, Kiriath Sanna (that is, Debir),
speaker: Narrator

text: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh; eleven cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Janim, Beth-tappuah, Aphekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Humtah, Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), and Zior; nine cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moan, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halhul, Beth Zur, Gedor,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maarath, Beth Anoth, and Eltekon; six cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim) and Rabbah; two cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the wilderness: Beth Arabah, Middin, Secacah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Nibshan, the city of Salt, and En Gedi; six cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the descendants of Judah were unable to drive out the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, so the Jebusites live with the descendants of Judah in Jerusalem to this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: The allotment of the descendants of Joseph went from the Jordan by Jericho, at the waters of Jericho to the east, into the wilderness, going up from Jericho into the hill country to Bethel;
speaker: Narrator

text: it continues from Bethel to Luz, and it passes along to the territory of the Arkites at Ataroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes down, to the west, to the territory of the Japhletites, up to the territory of Lower Beth-horon, then to Gezer, and it ends at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the descendants of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, received their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the border of the descendants of Ephraim according to their families: the border of their inheritance to the east was Ataroth Addar, up to Upper Beth-horon.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border continues to the sea; from Micmethath to the north, the border turns to the east to Taanath Shiloh, and it passes along it from the east to Janoah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes down from Janoah to Ataroth and to Naarah; it touches Jericho and ends at the Jordan;
speaker: Narrator

text: from Tappuah the border goes to the west, to the wadi of Kanah, and it ends at the sea. This is the inheritance of the tribe of the descendants of Ephraim according to their families,
speaker: Narrator

text: with the cities that were set apart for the descendants of Ephraim in the midst of the inheritance of the descendants of Manasseh, all the cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not drive out the Canananites who were dwelling in Gezer, and so the Canaanites live in the midst of Ephraim to this day, but they became forced laborers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the allotment was made for the tribe of Manasseh, because he was the firstborn of Joseph. To Makir, the firstborn of Manasseh, the father of Gilead, were allotted Gilead and Bashan, because he was a warrior.
speaker: Narrator

text: An allotment was made for the remaining descendants of Manasseh, according to their families: For the children of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida—these were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zelophehad son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Makir, son of Manasseh, had no sons, only daughters. These are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came before Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the leaders, saying, “Yahweh commanded Moses to give an inheritance to us among our kinsmen.” Therefore, according to the command of Yahweh he gave them an inheritance among the kinsmen of their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus ten shares fell to Manasseh, besides the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is beyond the Jordan,
speaker: Narrator

text: because the daughters of Manasseh received an inheritance among his sons. And the land of Gilead was allotted to the remaining descendants of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border of Manasseh was from Asher to Micmethath, which is opposite Shechem; then the border goes to the south, to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but Tuppuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the descendants of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border goes down to the wadi of Kanah to the south of the wadi. These cities belong to Ephraim among the cities of Manasseh. The border of Manasseh is north of the wadi, and it ends at the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The south is Ephraim’s, and the north is Manasseh’s; the sea is their border; Asher touches the north and on the east Issachar.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Issachar and Asher, Manasseh had Beth-shean and its villages, Ibleam and its villages, the inhabitants of Dor and its villages, the inhabitants of En-dor and its villages, the inhabitants of Taanach and its villages, the inhabitants of Megiddo and its villages; the third is Napheth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the descendants of Manasseh were not able to take possession of these towns; the Canaanites were determined to live in this land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it happened, when the Israelites grew strong, they put the Canaanites to forced labor but never drove them out completely.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Joseph spoke with Joshua, saying, “Why have you given us one allotment and one share as an inheritance? We are many people, which Yahweh has blessed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to them, “If you are many people, go up to the forest and clear a place there for yourselves in the land of the Perizzites and Rephaim, since the hill country of Ephraim is too narrow for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the descendants of Joseph said, “The hill country is not enough for us, and all of the Canaanites living in the land of the valley have chariots of iron, those in Beth-shean and its villages, and those in the Jezreel Valley.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are many people and have great power; you will not have one allotment only;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hill country will be yours. Even though it is a forest, you will clear it, and it will be yours to its farthest borders. You will drive out the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and are strong.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The entire congregation of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh, and they set up there the tent of meeting, and the land was subdued before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And seven tribes remained among the Israelites who had not been apportioned their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you be slack about going to take possession of the land that Yahweh, the God of your ancestors, has given you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Provide three men from each tribe, and I will send them so that they may begin to go through the land and write a description of it according to their inheritance, and let them come to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will divide it among themselves into seven portions; Judah will maintain its border from the south, and the house of Joseph will maintain its border from the north.
speaker: Narrator

text: Describe the land in seven divisions, and bring it to me here; I will cast lots for you here before Yahweh our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Levites among you have no portion, for their inheritance is the priesthood of Yahweh; Gad, Reuben, and the half-tribe of Manasseh received their inheritance beyond the Jordan to the east, which Moses Yahweh’s servant gave to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men went immediately, and Joshua commanded the ones going to describe the land, saying, “Go and walk about through the land, write a description, and return to me, and here I will cast a lot for you before Yahweh at Shiloh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men went and passed through the land, and they described the cities in seven divisions in a book; and they came to Joshua to the camp at Shiloh,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joshua cast a lot for them at Shiloh before Yahweh, and there he divided the land for the Israelites, to each a portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the allotment of the tribe of Benjamin came up according to their families, and the border of their allotment fell between the descendants of Judah and the descendants of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their northern border began at the Jordan and went up to the slope of Jericho on the north and continued into the hill country to the west; it ends at the wilderness of Beth Aven.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border passes on from there to Luz, to the slope of Luz to the south (that is, Bethel); then the border goes down to Ataroth Addar to the mountain that is south of Lower Beth-Horon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the border changes direction and turns to the western side southward, from the mountain that is opposite Beth-Horon to the south. It ends at Kiriath Baal (that is, Kiriath Jearim), a town belonging to the descendants of Judah. This is the western side.
speaker: Narrator

text: The southern side begins on the outskirts of Kiriath Jearim, and the border continues to the west to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah;
speaker: Narrator

text: the border goes down to the foot of the mountain, which is opposite the Valley of Ben Hinnom, which is in the valley of Rephaim to the north; then it does down the valley of Hinnom to the slope of the Jebusites to the south, and then it goes down to En Rogel.
speaker: Narrator

text: It changes direction from the north, and it continues to En Shemesh; it goes out to Geliloth, which is opposite the ascent of Adummim, and it goes down to the stone of Bohan, son of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: It passes on to the slope opposite the Arabah to the north, and it goes down to the Arabah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The border passes on to the slope of Beth-hoglah to the north and ends at the north bay of the Salt Sea at the south end of the Jordan. This is the southern border.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jordan forms its border on the eastern side. This is the inheritance of the tribe of Benjamin, its borders that surrounds them, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the towns of the tribes of the descendants of Benjamin, according to their families, were Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek Keziz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kephar Ammoni, Ophni, and Geba; twelve cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
speaker: Narrator

text: Mizpeh, Kephirah, Mozah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Zela, Haeleph, Jebus (that is, Jerusalem), Gibeah, and Kiriath; fourteen cities and their villages. This is the inheritance of the descendants of Benjamin according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second allotment fell for Simeon, for the tribe of the descendants of Simeon, according to their families. And their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the descendants of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they had as their inheritance Beersheba, Sheba, Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Hazar Shual, Balah, Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziklag, Beth Marcaboth, Hazar Susah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen; thirteen cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan; four cities and their villages,
speaker: Narrator
